d to let me know if I'm barking up the wrong mailing list for

We ha=
ve Ant experts here, but you may want to cross-post to an Ant mailing list =

>I'm trying to get all my junit tests in a suite to=
 run, even if there are
>one or more failures/errors.
>Afterwards, I want t=
he build to fail if there were any failures or errors.
>
>When I added this=
: haltonerror=3D"yes" haltonfailure=3D"yes" 
>to my <junit> tag in my ant f=
ile, no tests in my suite run after the first
>error/failure.
>This also fo=
rced me into using a <trycatch> to make sure my <junitreport>
>runs if ther=
e's an error failure :-(.
>If I remove these two attributes, the build does=
n't fail if there were
>errors/failures.
>
>Any suggestions?
